org.ma.ftc.lib.command

Class CommandBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ma.ftc.lib.command.CommandBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArcadeDriveCommand, DriveTrainCommand, DriveTrainInterrupt, InstantCommand, MAPath

    public abstract class CommandBase
extends java.lang.Object
    A state machine representing a complete action to be performed by the robot. Commands are run by the CommandScheduler.

    Commands are run synchronously from the main robot loop; no multithreading is used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandBase

        public CommandBase()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        The initial subroutine of a command. Called once when the command is initially scheduled.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        The main body of a command. Called repeatedly while the command is scheduled.

      • end

        public void end(boolean interrupted)
        The action to take when the command ends. Called when either the command finishes normally, or when it interrupted/canceled.
        Parameters:
        interrupted - whether the command was interrupted/canceled

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Whether the command has finished. Once a command finishes, the scheduler will call its end() method and un-schedule it.
        Returns:
        whether the command has finished.

      • addRequirements

        public void addRequirements(SubsystemBase... requirements)
        Adds the specified requirements to the command.
        Parameters:
        requirements - the requirements to add

      • schedule

        public void schedule(boolean interruptible)
        Schedules this command.
        Parameters:
        interruptible - whether this command can be interrupted by another command that shares one of its requirements

      • schedule

        public void schedule()
        Schedules this command, defaulting to interruptible.

      • isScheduled

        public boolean isScheduled()
        Whether or not the command is currently scheduled. Note that this does not detect whether the command is being run by a CommandGroup, only whether it is directly being run by the scheduler.
        Returns:
        Whether the command is scheduled.

      • setInterruptable

        public void setInterruptable(boolean interruptible)
        Sets whether the command is interruptible or not.
        Parameters:
        interruptible - whether this command can be interrupted by another command that shares one of its requirements

      • isInterruptible

        public boolean isInterruptible()
        Whether or not the command is interruptible or not .
        Returns:
        Whether the command is interruptible.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels this command. Commands will be canceled even if they are not marked as interruptible.

      • setAsDefaultCommand

        public void setAsDefaultCommand()
        Sets this command as a default command

      • getRequirements

        public SubsystemBase[] getRequirements()
        Specifies the array of subsystems used by this command. Two commands cannot use the same subsystem at the same time. If the command is scheduled as interruptible and another command is scheduled that shares a requirement, the command will be interrupted. Else, the command will not be scheduled. If no subsystems are required, return an empty set.
        Returns:
        the array of subsystems that are required
